Research Group Profile

Emerging Microbes and Infectious Diseases Research Group

Published

December 12, 2025

Group Information

  • Group Name: Emerging Microbes and Infectious Diseases
  • Research Focus: Investigation of emerging microbial pathogens and infectious disease surveillance

Team Members

Coordinator

  • Name: Dr. Andi Yasmon, M.Biomed, PhD
  • Title/Credentials: Doctor, Master in Biomedical Sciences, PhD
  • Email: andi.yasmon@ui.ac.id
  • Phone: +62 21 316 0491

    • Specialization: Virology and Microbiome Analysis
    • Email: fithriyah.sjatha@ui.ac.id

    • Title/Credentials: Doctor, PhD, Clinical Microbiology Specialist (Consultant in Virology)

    • Email: angky.budianti@ui.ac.id

    • Title/Credentials: Doctor, Master in Biomedical Sciences, PhD, Clinical Microbiology Specialist
    • Specialization: Viral Vaccine Development and Hepatitis C Virus (HCV)
    • Email: suratno.lulut01@ui.ac.id

  5. Prof. Dra. Beti Ernawati Dewi, Ph.D
    • Title/Credentials: Professor, PhD
    • Specialization: Molecular Virology (Dengue, Malaria) and Antiviral Development
    • Email: beti.ernawati@ui.ac.id

Research Areas

  • Emerging infectious diseases (Dengue, HIV, SARS-CoV-2)
  • Microbial surveillance and molecular epidemiology
  • Pathogen characterization (Genotyping, Drug Resistance)
  • Gut microbiome and host immune response
  • Vaccine and diagnostic kit development

Current Projects

  1. Gut Microbiota Profile in Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Patients
    • Duration: 2024 - 2025
    • Funding: Hibah PUTI UI / Domestic Grant
    • Brief description: Investigation of the correlation between clinical characteristics, anxiety/depression, and gut microbiota profiles in SLE patients.
  2. Characterization of Probiotic Candidates from Indonesian Fermented Milk
    • Duration: 2023 - 2025
    • Funding: Ministry of Research and Technology / BRIN
    • Brief description: Molecular characterization and safety assessment of Lactococcus lactis strains isolated from “Dadih” for potential oral probiotic use.
  3. Development of Dengue Detection Kit and Antiviral Therapies
    • Duration: 2023 - Present
    • Funding: Academia-Industry Innovation Grant (with PT Konimex)
    • Brief description: Collaborative research to develop high-sensitivity diagnostic kits for Dengue Hemorrhagic Fever and explore novel antiviral compounds.

Recent Publications

  • Astuti, A. K., Yasmon, A., et al. (2025). Characterization of Lactococcus lactis subspecies lactis strain Y-PDH01-07 isolated from traditional Indonesian fermented milk (dadih) as an oral probiotic candidate. Science Progress, 108(4).

  • Zaenab, Z., … Yasmon, A., et al. (2025). Immune Response to Capsular Polysaccharide of Streptococcus pneumoniae in Rabbits Immunized with Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine. HAYATI Journal of Biosciences, 32(3), 642-648.

  • Gebrina, M., … Dewi, B.E., Yasmon, A., et al. (2025). Patients with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus with Anxiety or Depression: Clinical Characteristics, Food Intake, and Gut Microbiota Profile. Acta Medica Indonesiana, 57(3), 295-305.

  • Rosana, Y., … Yasmon, A., et al. (2024). Antimicrobial Susceptibility Pattern and Molecular Characteristics of Multidrug-resistant Neisseria gonorrhoeae in Jakarta, Indonesia. Iranian Journal of Medical Microbiology, 18(4), 238-246.

  • Angky Budianti, et al. (2025). Distribusi Infeksi Mycobacterium tuberculosis Ekstra Paru. Jurnal Ilmiah Multidisipliner, 3(4).

Collaborations

  • Domestic: RSUPN Dr. Cipto Mangunkusumo (RSCM), PT Konimex, Universitas Pertahanan, Universitas Mataram
  • International: Tohoku University (Japan), Osaka University (Japan), SEAMEO TROPMED Regional Centre for Microbiology, Parasitology and Entomology

Resources & Facilities

  • Molecular Virology Laboratory: Equipped for viral culture, neutralization assays, and molecular detection of emerging viruses (Dengue, HIV, CMV).
  • Microbiome & Metagenomics Unit: Facilities for NGS-based microbiome analysis and bioinformatics processing at department of Microbiology - Virology & Molecular Laboratory.
